pageContext.description: Good condition. 4 raised ribs clearly defined - on both faces. Cast marks. Scratches scored on faces near edge.
pageContext.patina: Much chipped patina dark green, showing pale green and dark red brown bronze metal.
pageContext.publications: No. 31 in Exhibition of local antiquities at Oswestry, Aug. 1923 on the occasion of the Cambrian Arch. Assocs. visit.,Not in Montgomeryshire Inventory 1911
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1920,43,Mr. R. Roberts,The Stpres, Penyboutfawr Montgom.,(parish Pennant)
pageContext.site: Wales,Montgomeryshire,Hirnant,Bachedocthian Farm Farm 1869 by Mr. Richs Evans,turned up by a pick, at a depth of a few inches.,Near Penybontfawr Tanat volley in Hirnant Parish[
